externalDocs.description: To install the API on your website, click here.

get.description: For all queries of Bible information in our database.

reference.name: reference
reference.description: To find a passage reference (i.e. Psalm63:1-2).

search.name: search
search.description: To look for verses with specific words (i.e. love, joy, peace).

request.name: request
request.description: Receives keywords or bible references. Cannot receive both. If a passage is used, the `200` response is the same as the response when using the `reference` parameter. If a keyword is used, the response format is the same as the response when using the `search` parameter.

data_format.name: data_format
data_format.description:
Formats the structure of the endpoint response. Parameter values can either be:
- **Passage** - For more informative responses
- **Raw / minimal** - For more concise responses

bible.name: bible
bible.description: Translation of the bible. Can be a string, array, or JSON encoded array.

whole_words.name: whole_words
whole_words.description: Sets the search and keyword parameters to search for whole words.

exact_case.name: exact_case
exact_case.description: Sets the search and keyword parameters to search for exact case.

highlight.name: highlight
highlight.description: Setting to true will wrap the highlight tag around the keyword.

highlight_tag.name: highlight_tag
highlight_tag.description: The HTML tag used to highlight keywords.

page.name: page
page.description: The number of the page to show.

context.name: context
context.description: Shows the verses surrounding the given verse.

context_range.name: context_range
context_range.description: The amount of verses pulled by the context parameter.

search_type.name: search_type
search_type.description: The type of search when using the keyword search. 'and' or 'all_words' - searches for verses with the given words. 'or' or 'any_word'  - seaches for verses mentioning at least one of the given words. 'xor' or 'one_word' - searches for verses with one of the given words. two_or_more' - searches for verses with two or more of the given words.'

keyword_limit.name: keyword_limit
keyword_limit.description: Sets the minimum amount of keywords for keyword searches.

proximity_limit.name: proximity_limit
proximity_limit.description: Sets the range of verses of allowable verses between keywords. Default is 5.

markup.name: markup
markup.description: Formats the markup for Strongs numbers or red letters. 'None', or 'raw'. 'raw' returns the markup as stored in the database. {} = srongs numbers, [] = added words, ‹› = red letters (not <>). Default is 5.

parallel_search_error_suppress.name: parallel_search_error_suppress
parallel_search_error_suppress.description: The 'verses from this Bible have been included for comparison' errors won't show.

verse_index_chapter.title: Verse index chapter
verse_index_chapter.description: The verse numbers for the given chapter in the search. The verses are in integer format.

text.example: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips:

chapter_verse.title: Chapter verses
chapter_verse.description: A verse object that contains information about a single verse. Chapter verses are numbers in the form of a string.

5.text: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips:

translation_chapter.title: Translation chapter
translation_chapter.description: A chapter object for a given translation. Each chapter object contains a verse object. Chapter objects are numbers in the form of a string.

5.text: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips:

nav.title: nav
nav.description: Contains metadata for navigating multiple verses. Only applicable when searching for multiple verses.

ncb_name.description: Next chapter book name. For the name of the ncb.

prev_chapter.description: For the previous chapter of the book.

pcb_name.description: Previous chapter book name. For the name of the pcb.

cur_chapter.description: For the name of the current chapter of the book.

ccb_name.description: Current chapter book name. Used for the name of the ccb.

ncb.description: Next chapter book id. Used to identify the book of the next chapter of the search entry.

ncc.description: Next chapter chapter id. Used to identify the chapter for the next chapter of the search entry.

pcb.description: Previous chapter book id. Used to identify the book for the previous chapter of the search entry.

pcc.description: Previous chapter chapter id. Used to identify the chapter for the previous chapter of the search entry.

ccb.description: Current chapter book id. Used to identify the book of the search entry.

ccc.description: Current chapter chapter id. Used to identify the chapter of the search entry.

nb.description: Book id for the next book.

pb.description: Book id for the previous book.

query_results_passage.description: Lists information about the books, chapters, and verses related to the parameter details in the request. Returns results based on the `data_format`, which determines the structure of the results.

book_short.description: A shortened name for the book.

book_raw.description: The name entered by the user for the name of the book.

chapter_verse_raw.description: The chapter and verse entered by the user.

verse_index.description: Contains arrays of each chapter in the search.

verses.description: Details about the searched verses in passage format.

verses_count.description: The amount of verses searched for.

single_verse.description: Shows if the user searched for one verse or not.

translation_verse.title: Translation verse
translation_verse.description: When using the 'raw' data format, the results object displays verse information for a given translation. This differs from the 'passage' format, which gives a chapter object and a verse object that holds the verse information. The results object for 'raw' searches only display arrays of verse information for the translation specified in the search.

example.text: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips:

query_results_raw.description: Lists verse information based on the parameter details in the request. Returns results based on the `data_format`, which determines the structure of the results.

query.title: Query response schema
query.description: The response schema for the query endpoint.

hash.description: A hash code for the endpoint.

disambiguation.description: The purpose of this object is still under investigation.

strongs.description: The contents of this object is unclear. The Strong's definitions endpoint (https://api.biblesupersearch.com/api/strongs) returns Strong's definitions, but this doesn't seem to connected to this object.

paging.description: Returns objects that contain information about the pages of the results. Information such as - Current page of results - URL for the first page - The search result that starts on the current page - The page number of the last page of results - URL for the last page - URLs for all pages of results - URL path for the endpoint - Search results per page - The number of search results for the current page - Total number of search results

errors.description: If errors occur during the request, this array displays messages about the errors.

error_level.description:
Indicates the type of error that occurred: 
  - **0** - no error
  - **1** or **2** - reserved for future use
  - **3** - non-fatal error
  - **4** - fatal error

results.description:
Search results and/or Biblical passages based on the information provided in the request. The structure depends on the `data_format` parameter.
- **passage** (default) - Returns verse data, along with additional information about the book and chapter. When you do not provide a `data_format`, this is the format of the results object.
- **raw** - Returns verse data and less information about books and chapters.

error.title: error
error.description: The response schema for a 400 error.

hash.description: A hash code for the endpoint.

disambiguation.description: The purpose of this object is still under investigation.

errors.description: If errors occur during the request, this array displays messages about the errors.

error_level.description:
Indicates the type of error that occurred: 
  - **0** - no error
  - **1** or **2** - reserved for future use
  - **3** - non-fatal error
  - **4** - fatal error

reference_passage.description: Response for a reference query in a **passage** `data_format` (e.g. Psalms63:1-2).

1.text: ¶ A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah. O God, thou art my God; early will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh longeth for thee in a dry and thirsty land, where no water is;

2.text: To see thy power and thy glory, so as I have seen thee in the sanctuary.

reference_raw.description: Response for a reference query in a **raw** `data_format` (e.g. Psalms63:1-2).

kjv.text: ¶ A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah. O God, thou art my God; early will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh longeth for thee in a dry and thirsty land, where no water is;
To see thy power and thy glory, so as I have seen thee in the sanctuary.

search_passage.description: Response for a search query in a **passage** `data_format` (e.g. Peace).

15.text: And thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace; thou shalt be buried in a good old age.

search_raw.description: Response for a search query in a **raw** `data_format` (e.g. Peace).

kjv.text: And thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace; thou shalt be buried in a good old age.
And the man wondering at her held his peace, to wit whether the LORD had made his journey prosperous or not.

error.description: Response for when the request could not retrieve the specified information.

errors: An error messgae about the request and how to fix it.
